summary.Title: Software Developer with experience in networking and web
summary.JobHeadline: Software Developer with experience in networking and web

JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Software Developer with experience in networking and web
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
About Us

Come join a company that is already at full speed ahead, pushing the limits of optimizing networking. As the ever-increasing desire for fast and reliable internet is quickly becoming a necessity, so is the need for efficient and performant ways of achieving it. Teledriving, video calls, online multiplayer gaming, cloud streaming, satellite or underwater communication, and many other uses are dependent on ultra-low latency and highly reliable connectivity to be viable. These are just some of the exciting use cases for our technology, every day we find new applications where we can make networks smarter and experiences more seamless.

Steinwurf was founded in 2011 by an international team of researchers. We specialize in innovating and developing smart network technologies by reaping the benefits of our high-performance erasure correcting codes. Steinwurf today provides patented algorithms for e.g. low latency communication, reliable multicast, and distribution of large files, which are sold as off-the-shelf software components to companies.

  • Rely Demonstration [YouTube]  (0:31)
  • Fixing choppy and bad resolution video calls in Slack [YouTube] (5:46)

What your day would look like

We’re looking for a software developer with experience in creating and maintaining native applications. You’ll be creating applications such as network tunnel software running on various system platforms such as Linux, Windows, MacOS, iOS, and Android.  You’ll work with a team of other motivated, talented, and hardworking engineers to design and implement the applications and tools required to take Steinwurf to new levels of success. While our technology is primarily written using C/C++, we also use Go for writing native applications, React/TypeScript for our graphical user interface for both web and native, and Python for tooling and testing. Being part of a focused team means the need for boring meetings is kept to a minimum, and for the most part you’ll be concentrating on developing high-quality work. We have a very loose hierarchy meaning that everybody's opinions are always heard and valued, as we firmly believe that good results are achieved in collaboration. In general, we weigh willingness to learn high, so we seek a passionate software developer who seeks to master their craftsmanship and takes pride in developing well-tested and high-quality code.

Also, you will be working at our office located in the NOVI buildings on the Aalborg University campus, where we speak both English and Danish, and where we daily get to enjoy the most amazing food in the canteen. You’ll also be able to work from home but we do expect you to be in the office some days as we believe it’s important to meet in person with the people you work with.

Responsibilities

  • Creating and maintaining cloud-based applications utilizing Steinwurf's solutions
  • Network configuration for Steinwurf’s software solutions.
  • Develop new Software to showcase the power of erasure correcting codes.
  • Work on new tools to ease the development flow of yourself and your colleagues.

Job Qualifications

  • Can be productive in one or more of the following languages: C, C++, Go or Python
  • Knows how to use Git and Github (experience with Github actions is a plus)
  • Practical experience with network protocols and programming  (IP, TCP, UDP, WebSocket, etc.)
  • Experience with front-end technologies such as Typescript, React, HTML5, SASS/LESS, etc. is a plus
  • Knowledge about edge/cloud programming (containers, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.) is a plus.

So, if you think you are the right person for the job, don’t hesitate to contact us and come join us as we push for the worldwide adoption of our technologies, together.
